alert.note: Alert for Southern Meade Co Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued January 23 at 3:15AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .DISCUSSION...Skies will be variably cloudy today with high temperatures in the upper 40s to mid 50s. Northwesterly winds will increase to 20 to 35 mph with gusts to around 50 mph across much of the northwest and west central South Dakota plains. Elsewhere, wind speeds of 15 to 25 mph and gusts to 40 mph are expected. Relative humidities will drop to 25 to 40 percent in the afternoon. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Monday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the moderate category.
